message:
guys i've an idea about a new activity in our group.

after this post https://www.facebook.com/groups/egyptian.geeks/734993243207053/

i liked that debate between us. so why don't we have something like debates. for example PHP vs Ruby. and get the experts from both side to start the debate. i'll help the group members enhancing their skills. whta do you think guys?!
name: Egyptian Geeks
description:
so guys do you've an idea which is better: ajax long polling or using web sockets when implementing a notification system?! 

if we're talking about a server with good infrastructure does it matter to migrate from ajax to websockets?! 
does it has a problem with big dat...

data.message: because php vs ruby is stupid =D.
If most of the members are the kind of people who would be interested in "php vs ruby", then we have a problem, and we don't attract the crowd we think we want.

Ask Developer hangouts might be a more suitable place for this. The hangouts have a wider audience that includes beginners (unlike this group), who may benefit from knowing how PHP and Ruby are different in the first place.

I like the idea Alaa Attya Mohamed and I agree with Mohamed Meligy that the hangouts are a good venue for these topics. So far, we've been using the hangouts for tutorials/lectures/demos and general open discussions. Adding debates to it would be a good idea.

However, I think that "ruby vs php" is a bad example. No "religious wars" as Scott Hanselman describe these discussions. Maybe compare two technologies and figure out pros and cons. This would be a better way to describe it.
just google it and you 'll find many answers

I used to jump on these cage matches, but it turns out that programming language selection is not always objective. Something like significant white space in Python is considered a disadvantage, while most pythonistas consider it a good thing.

On the other hands, I believe it will be healthier if we compare programming languages as "different", not better or worse. They can work together, even if they are very similar like Ruby & Python. As an example, pygments is a popular syntax highlighter which has wrappers in many different languages, although it's written in Python.

Amr Eldib yes i mean doing those debates as hangout. BTW you're right about "ruby vs php" :D msh 3aref el example el 3ageeb eli ana katbto dah. but i was just come across mind cz a friend of mind was just aked me :D
Ebram Tharwat i'm not talking about the difference between the two languages it's just an example (bad one BTW :D) i'm talking about debates between experts who we can benefit

Mohammad Tayseer you're right. i mean doing debates between for example two different technologies or schools. like i was just asking "notifications via ajax or via sockets". or may be debates about enhancing and optimizing your development stack. you can let the group members choose the two sides and have a vote about on debate, then start a hangout about it.

These things come as people need / ask them. I think bringing them up for the sake of bringing them up will not be inspiring enough to make good ones. Just bring them on whenever you have a real question in your head :)
